definitions: a board or screen placed over or behind a pulpit or stage to reflect a speaker's voice forward.
shortDefinitions: board or screen placed over or behind pulpit or stage

definitions: a person or group whose reactions to suggested ideas are used as a test of their validity or likely success before they are made public

examples.text: I considered him mainly as a sounding board for my impressions

shortDefinitions: person or group whose reactions to suggested ideas are used as test of their validity or likely success before they are made public

definitions: a channel through which ideas are disseminated

examples.text: neighborhood councils provide a sounding board for local opinion

shortDefinitions: channel through which ideas are disseminated
